content: Joshua Challenges Israel to be Faithful
A long time passed after the  made Israel secure from all their enemies, and Joshua was very old.
So Joshua summoned all Israel, including the elders, rulers, judges, and leaders, and told them: “I am very old.
You saw everything the  your God did to all these nations on your behalf, for the  your God fights for you.
See, I have parceled out to your tribes these remaining nations, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west, including all the nations I defeated.
The  your God will drive them out from before you and remove them, so you can occupy their land as the  your God promised you.
Be very strong! Carefully obey all that is written in the law scroll of Moses so you won’t swerve from it to the right or the left,
or associate with these nations that remain near you. You must not invoke or make solemn declarations by the names of their gods! You must not worship or bow down to them!
But you must be loyal to the  your God, as you have been to this very day.
“The  drove out from before you great and mighty nations; no one has been able to resist you to this very day.
One of you makes a thousand run away, for the  your God fights for you, as he promised you he would.
Watch yourselves carefully! Love the  your God!
But if you ever turn away and make alliances with these nations that remain near you, and intermarry with them and establish friendly relations with them,

know for certain that the  your God will no longer drive out these nations from before you. They will trap and ensnare you; they will be a whip that tears your sides and thorns that blind your eyes until you disappear from this good land the  your God gave you.

“Look, today I am about to die. You know with all your heart and being that not even one of all the faithful promises the  your God made to you is left unfulfilled; every one was realized—not one promise is unfulfilled!

But in the same way every faithful promise the  your God made to you has been realized, it is just as certain that if you disobey, then the  will bring on you every judgment until he destroys you from this good land that the  your God gave you.

If you violate the covenantal laws of the  your God which he commanded you to keep, and follow, worship, and bow down to other gods, then the  will be very angry with you and you will disappear quickly from the good land that he gave to you.”
